description:
Python is an extremely dynamic language with a very "rich runtime." Unlike in a compiled language like C or go, symbols (functions and data objects) can be bound and rebound at runtime; swapped out without the need for complicated syntax and without the risk of unsafe complications.
In the Python community, this is called "monkey-patching." But it's not as bananas as it sounds!
In fact, it can be a very useful mechanism for extending functionality or for making robust, surgical fixes to a code-base!
title: Python Gone Bananas: Monkey Patching Isn't Monkey Business
